description: Update README.md to document new cookiecutter parameters: use_dated_prefix (US-002) and open_ide (US-003). Only applies if both features are fully implemented and tested.
motivation: Users need to know about new features. Documentation enables adoption and reduces support questions.
implementation_details:
CRITICAL: Before proceeding, verify both parameters exist in cookiecutter.json:
- use_dated_prefix: Controls whether to add date prefix to directory name
- open_ide: Controls which IDE opens after generation (none, vscode, pycharm)

If parameters missing from cookiecutter.json, this task cannot proceed.

If parameters exist, update README.md with new section:

## Configuration Parameters

The cookiecutter supports the following parameters:

| Parameter | Default | Options | Description |
|-----------|---------|---------|-------------|
| kata_name | DummyKata | string | Name for the kata/project |
| use_dated_prefix | yes (if implemented) | yes, no | Add YYYYMMDD prefix to directory name |
| directory_name | Generated | string | Override auto-generated directory name |
| open_ide | none (if implemented) | none, vscode, pycharm | IDE to open after generation |

## Usage Examples

### Standard kata (dated prefix, no IDE):
```bash
cookiecutter gh:undeadgrishnackh/_template_Python_
```

### Clean directory for monorepo integration:
```bash
cookiecutter gh:undeadgrishnackh/_template_Python_ \
  use_dated_prefix=no \
  kata_name=trading-engine
```

### Interactive development with VS Code:
```bash
cookiecutter gh:undeadgrishnackh/_template_Python_ \
  open_ide=vscode
```

### 5D-Wave agent usage (automation safe):
```bash
cookiecutter gh:undeadgrishnackh/_template_Python_ \
  use_dated_prefix=no \
  kata_name=source
# No IDE opens, terminal returns control immediately
```
